p: IL-18 has a strong pro-inflammatory activity so inhibition of the pro-inflammatory cascade triggered by IL-18 can be a therapeutic target not only for the treatment of inflammatory diseases but also for cytokine storm. Gabay et al. published the results in open-label, multicenter study of tadekinig-Î±, recombinant human interleukin-18 binding protein (IL-18BP) in adult-onset Still's disease (Phase II). They concluded that IL-18 inhibition might offer another possibility of therapy within the scope of anti-cytokine treatment such as NLRC4-related macrophage activation syndrome, the etiological factor leading to clinical manifestation of CRS [ 38].
